page.title: 03SHOPPING CENTRES IN ERSKINE
page.content: Ten years ago Erskine had only a few shops but since then changes have been made. A shopping centre had been planned and on the 4th January, 1985, Bridgewater Shopping Centre was officially opened. It is situated in the centre of Erskine with two connecting pedestrian bridges making it easily accessible for shoppers from the different areas in Erskine. A large area has been made into a car park. The first shops to open were a large supermarket, a frozen food shop, a newsagents and a shoe shop. A new library has recently been opened. There will be further developements to the main shopping centre with a chemist and bank planned to open in the near future. Erskine has also got three smaller shopping areas. Each has a selection of shops that serve the people in that particular area.
